content: Sadly...My tablet that I use for gaming program like this (which is newer than my phone) is labelled as not compatible. I did buy for my phone...Developer please fix this issue
Instructions are terrible
This app works flawlessly. I've played rise of flight, il2, and fs2020, and they are all perfect
It works great!

I initially had some issues with my home router, setting SmoothTrack up to communicate with my PC. Followed an easy guide though to create a static IP address and create a port forward. I'm using SmoothTrack for Star Citizen and it's great! I can even use it effectively on foot in FPS as well as cockpit flight. I highly recommend SmoothTrack especially since it is so much cheaper than the more expensive options.
Fonctionne parfaitement sur MSFS2020. Je recommande.

Completely transforms Flight Simulator 2020! This is by far the best money I've ever spent. It sure beats a $300+ VR headset and does exactly what I was looking for, the ability to easily look around just by turning my head. This is hands down a MUST HAVE for anyone with FS2020! I'm amazed how how simple yet effective it is! It took me back in time to my flight training days and made it all feel so real again. Awesome job developer(s)! Absolutely outstanding execution! üëèüëåüôå
Simple to set up, easy to use with a price that can't be beat for what you get. Best value in head-tracking!

So simple but so good. Top stuff. It does appear the android setup instructions are a little dated and could get an update. Example no start button. Only paused or running in android. I did have to disable my network pv6 to make it work but thats fine for me. Well done.
Love this app - it makes head tracking easy for anyone to setup! Currently using this with star wars squadrons, dcs a10, and city driving sim
Wow. I didnt believe this would work that great. I was wrong. This app is fantastic works near flawless. Very happy with it and only 10 bucks Thank you for making it Dev.
Wondering if this app works with FSX? I cant seen to get it to work, but in DCS it is just fine.
Excellent! Started using it to play Farming Simulator 19 and it works great. Will be using it for ATS and ETS2 as well. Great app!
Great app... true 6DOF and smooth tracking!!!

First I thought it would be scam since I saw it at facebook but, it turned out to be an amazing f.u.c.k.i.n.g app!!! It works and is really smooth. No imput lag, no loss connection. No problems at all. Best $10 dollars ever.
Excellent app. Works great on Google Pixal 4a.
The only problem I have with this app is the lag. I've tried the USB method (check discord server on smooth track website) and that helps a bit but still just a bit too much delay.
Very easy to setup and works flawlessly. Thanks!
Cannot get working on my phone. Emailed but no reply!
Really profesional and easy to follow setup tutorial - it's tracking my head great!
Works straight out of the box. Worth the price for ease of use.
Amazing for the price. As others have said, you have to try it to believe its as good as people say it is for just ¬£10.

I was skeptical, but this works really really well! I had to do a bit of learning about vjoy and how to bind keys for a virtual joystick, but it works perfectly now that I understand it. John was really good about communicating with me and pointing me in the right direction. Highly recommend this for your head tracking needs!
It actually works... Works on msfs2020 straight away. Now just need to find a way to mount the mobile phone under the monitor

Does what I didn't think was possible! I can't believe how good it is and how well it works for the price compared to trackir. Unfortunately doesn't work on the older model tablet I've got on my desk due to lack of AR support on the operating system so I have to use my phone for the moment, but that's not your fault!

Actually works on MFS2020! My money worth spent than buying TrackIR which cost 100 times more. Once u got it working on the app & system, MFS2020 auto runs it so No setup in the game is required. Not sure if it will run on other FPS games tho.

I honestly don't know how I was able to live without this app. I read a thread on FS2020 forums and someone mentionned SmoothTrack. 15 minutes later it was purchased, installed and working flawlessly. I just love it and can't say enough about it. Ease of installation and ease of use is what blew me away. 2 thumbs up to the dev for creating this awesome app. Thank you once again :-)

Saw this app on FB one day and was curious to try it out. Tested it with American Truck Simulator and boy I was impressed! The only drawback is the little latency lag. If you can't afford TrackIR or Tobii then this the must-have alternative!
Very good affordable alternative to trackir. Latency in wireless mode is noticeable (about 0.3 of a second delay) but otherwise tracking is very good.

The app works perfectly, I was sceptical but it was less then a tenner so just went for it, but I am not disappointed. If u are on a budget u simply can't get something better for the price. I use it for my disabled dad to play American Truck Sim and it has helped him so much. Full credit to the developer cos this is simply exceptional work. I seriously can't fault this from price to step by step guide of how to use, took me 15 minutes to set up and it will be used for years to come

Impeccable. The best thing next to VR. Bought it for MSFS but I have made good use of it on other games with headtracking but no VR support - F1 2019, Arma 3, etc. No issues at all with a Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 Lite. Tip for new users: make sure to setup the axis curves and thresholds on Opentrack so you don't have to rotate your head away from the screen. Exaggerating the camera movement is a must for headtracking and feels completely natural, so you can have your camera look 90¬∞ away from the center with only a 30¬∞ head rotation. Only negatives: you can't use it effectively in low light, but that's an inherent problem of the tech being used, not the app.

I was a bit sceptical at first, but the app blew me away. Even with the wireless connection the app works exactly like you would expect. Even in low light conditions I didn't have any problems. There is also a wired option available for even less latency. A awesome feature in the app is to turn off the screen, this way you don't get distracted while playing! Overal a really great app and super cheap compared to TrackIR. I've also tried facetracknoir but this app feels more responsive.
Works verry well i was suprised how many games its compatible with love using on arma 3

The app works perfectly for DCS, especially when you have a low spec computer and need to push the tracking computations to a phone instead. John was even helpful when I reached out with stutter/jittery tracking issues after a month of using app!

It works. I hope the dev keeps working on this to add wired mode and make it visually pleasing. What features, if any, are you planning on adding? Just under ¬£10 is worth it and if you play games like sim games. Well done. Edit: if your phone is rooted you can fiddle with things to make it work in wired mode. If you have a cat that likes to chill with you while playing games it'll lose tracking and use the cat which is just wonderful.
Excellent app! Works for me in DCS, XPlane 11 and FSX. The developer is also contactable and very helpful.
Awesome, thanks for this amazing app

Absolutely superb piece of programming. Simple to set up. Took me no more than five minutes. This really is the dogs bollocks. How have I not discovered it before now?!! Worth every penny. Buy it. You won't regret it.

You get a lot for this price, the quality is good. Integrating the app with OpenTrack was fairly easy. The thing I have the most trouble with is that it won't recognize up and down head movements (pitch) when I'm looking almost all the way to the right or left. For combat flight sims this is crucial and quite annoying when it doesn't work. Secondly, it would be helpful to have a USB communication to lower the delay which is OK at the moment (at least I hope a different communication would help). Lastly, the stability is OK as well, there's quite some work to be done here to improve it - maybe it's not possible with a face recognition algorithms. To sum it up, you get a pretty good product for this price, and I highly recommend buying it if you're interested in having a cheap way of tracking your head for your sim games.
Set up for IL2 in around 5 minutes.. works flawlessly! Fantastic work! :D
Fantastic, life changing app!
Fantastic value. my brain might be slow on the uptake but it works very well. I recommend anyone trying it out look up the discord channel and get some presets!
I love it alot but i really hope the dev can make the delay better, it's quite noticeable imo. Maybe these are limitations by network i dont know. But it's the biggest issue for me personally

Awesome app that gives you full head tracking ability in game and only cost 6 bucks! Dev is really in tune with feedback and regularly makes improvements. Fine tuning is a bit confusing and requires a bit of trial and error but it works great in MSFS20.

Gamechanger!!! (pun intended) I will never play Flight simulator without this. Battery drain is kinda extreme and can't find the option to switch cameras but let's be realistic: I'm hooked from the first moment I tried the app and no shortcomings that it has won't make me stop using it

Best $5 I've spent in awhile! This is a really good head tracking app thats super cheap! I thought maybe this app wouldnt do that well with tracking your head, but it proved me wrong! The only thing I could see people complaining about is the difficulty of setup, and maybe even with what little latency there is. I dont notice the latency while playing games and the setup was pretty easy to me. Thank you for this wonderful app!
Great value, and works quite well! One of those apps you are happy to pay for :)

Recently got into American Truck Simulator and had the steering wheel setup. I had always thought about a head or ir tracker but didn't want to spend the cash or the time setting it up. I heard about this app and that people had a good experience. I also had some Google money from doing surveys so I gave it a shot and am so glad I did. I set it up as per the instructions and it works as advertised. I didn't have to change any settings or anything. Great app!!!

Absolutely amazing! Worth every penny I've paid. Didn't expect too much but once set and launched I couldn't believe. Only small detail I would suggest to improve is UI. Could do with bit more modern look for such a incredible tool.
Couldn't get it to work no matter how many times I tried and uninstalled and reinstalled. I really wanted this to work.
replyContent: Dan - sorry to hear you are having issues. Please contact me at contact@smoothtrack.app and I'll try to figure out what the issue may be.

content: Wonderful app that really works. I especially appreciate the supprt I got from the developers. A flight simmers must have!

Works great, I was wondering though is it also possible to do this directly over usb? My wifi tends to be a bit unstable and I think it would be a killer feature for most of us. Thank you for you great work!
It does what it promises.

Quite amazing really. Pretty simple to set up if you follow the directions... brings flight simming to a new level. There was nothing to configure within flight sim 2020 itself, I loaded up the Cessna and it was already working.
Excellent, worked first time, great for Microsoft flight sim 2020

Works really well in MFS2020, it is really smooth and easy to use once you have done a bit of research (looked at YouTube videos). Just took a few goes to get my phone to connect to my PC but once connected, brilliant. Especially for the price, cannot argue.

Exactly what I was hoping for! All the benefits of TrackIR but for a fraction of the price! At first it was a bit twitchy but after rebooting my phone it started working correctly. If for some reason it does not connect, recheck your IP address. I have a ORBI router with a satellite and although the SSID is identical the IP address between the two are different. This makes MSFS2020 a million times more enjoyable and the movement is very natural!
Hi, i've bought the app and it√¨s really cool! (just a litltle bit of lag but it's ok) just one question: why can't i use the back camera of my smartphone?

Tested so for and works well with ATS,ETS2, and Fernbus Simulator.. Very little setup required and it performs amazing. I would like it to be a little less sensitive for looking left and right but for $10, no problem.
Great app, worked well along with open track
Brilliant! Works very well for Assetto Corsa (PC).

Amazing app. I use for DCS and BMS. I also have Track IR but this is my go to. I couldn't find a support email so wish to ask the developer this. It communicates via the Internet but sometimes there is lag. Track IR plugs into my PC via USB. If I connect my phone to my PC via cable will it still use the Internet to track or will it communicate via the cable, thus reducing lag?

Definitely an app to give a go. It works amazingly well and provides a smooth tracking with almost virtually no lag. Just because it removes the pain of having IR leds and a camera setup is already a huge gain. Been using it successfully for both DCS and MSFS 2020. Might require a bit of tweaking of the dead zones and smoothing on the curves.

What an app! I cant recommend this app enough, I have always wanted to experience playing a flight simulator using head movements and this app allows you to do that without paying a fortune for the equipment all you need is a phone and this app and there you go.
SMOOTH! And does the processing in the phone rather than the PC, so under high CPU load, it doesn't lag! This should be included with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020!!!

Was all good until today, I have been using for past 3 days it works really good with fs2020 when you get the right settings. But suddenly today it does not work. I've tried to get it working but to no avail...
replyContent: Hi, can you please try rebooting your device. Please contact us at contact@smoothtrack.app if the issue persists.

content: Works great. Use it with mainly in DCS.
This app is awesome. Took no time to get it communicating to my computer. I use it with MSFS2020. No setup needed. Worked like a charm. $10 well spent.
Latency really noticeable when compared to my TIR3.
replyContent: You may want to try connecting via USB, that should help with any latency. Contact me at contact@smoothtrack.app for info on this if you are interested!

content: Great piece of software
Make sure you've turned your wireless on before getting uppity at the app haha

If I'm honest I really didn't expect it to work. I paid ¬£9.49 and I have a really old and slow pc. Installed it within 10 minutes for use on xplane 11 and it works brilliantly!! No point buying an expensive track IR kit when you can get this for less than ¬£10!! It's amazing!!

Your experience may vary, but there was too much latency and stuttering for me to use this, and the headtracking is very inaccurate if you have to have the camera at an angle pointing up at you from your desk.
replyContent: Could you try the latest update and see if it works for you now? If not, please contact me at contact@smoothtrack.app and I'll help you out. For example, there is now a way to connect via USB which helps with latency when there are network issues.

content: For $10 bucks it's pretty good.

I can't believe this is for real. ‚Ç¨10? Sure it's not perfect, but for ‚Ç¨10 and nothing more then a decent light source for it to work. Super easy and fast to get up running. I sure it will only get better with time, if the developer got this app this good right from the start he has to be a code wizard and a math genius. I do recommend that you download the developers own preset for Opentrack (default.ini) from his website I found it a really good starting point. Thank you John you're amazing!
Excellent piece of software. I use it with Euro truck simulator and it improved the overall experience. The last update made it perfect!
Absolutely phenomenal app but unfortunately I refunded it. This was not because of the app itself but rather XPlanes implementation of trackir is frustrating to use.

Saw this on Reddit and finally had some time to give it a go. I haven't fine tuned the sensitivity but I'm blown away this was done so well. If the camera can expose for your face you're pretty much in business cus I was using this in a slightly under lit corner of my room (basically the TV was illuminating me). This might stave off buying an VR headset until next gens are fleshed out. Great job! I've already demo'd it with some friends via video chat and they're amazed haha
Followed the instructions, was playing FS2020 with head tracking I less than 15min.
It works as advertised but why should I use this over the free opentrack? Opentrack tracks your phone, this tracks your head!

I'm giving it 5 stars only because of all of the excitement around it (and it working for pretty much everyone else), however, for some/whatever reason, this app does not work for me at all; the square that is supposed to show your front facing camera is blank (dark-grey-ish) without the green circle besides it, and when set to running does not seem to even attempt a connection nor send any data, no matter what I do or try even beyond the included instructions.
Amazing. Stop reading and just buy it. Works great for MSFS2020. I
Simple, clean setup and working with existing architecture allows this to get up and running within 15mins. Works well in conjuction with Assetto Corsa.
Surpassed my expectations in terms of accuracy and speed of tracking, and the install instructions are very easy to follow.

Excellent app. A few adjustments of the sensitivites to suit my setup and it works fantastic in MSFS2020. Allow a little time to get used to the movements. I set the roll sensitivity to almost zero to stop a weird swing in external view. Its a cheap way to get head tracking, compared with TrackIR, etc.

Followed the instructions and worked. Got some tweaking to do. Some stutter, but probably on my end between phone and pc. Still opened a whole new reality. My landings were far smoother. To hell with a mouse. Lol

Awesome app but Latency is a little slow for Sim racing if you need to move your head quickly. Probably the cameras fault more than the software. Any tips to enhance this would be great. :) I've tinkered enough to make it pleasant.
Wish I could give this 10 stars. Worth every penny. My first time trying head tracking with P3D and I am NOT disappointed. Works like a charm, thank you so much for this amazing tool.

This app is incredible. I got it for DCS. It was very easy to set up by following the instructions on the website. The tracking is excellent. I get no noticible lag on my wifi and it works great. I need to fine tune the curves a bit more, but after just a minute or two of adjusting, it is working wonderfully. I tried it briefly on ETS2 and it worked there as well. This really helps with situational awareness and being able to look around the in game environment is incredible. No need to buy Tir5

Works just as advertised. I use it with OpenTrack as described by the author and you really need to fiddle with the curves and settings to get the most out of it. But when done it works superbly. One of the cheapest and simplest solutions for DIY headtracking using what you already have. I was using HeadtrackNoIR before but this seems to work better so far.

Works like a charm, making game so much more realistic..use it with ms flight simulator 2020 and brought whole new realism to the game where I can look anywhere and track any ground target while tracking. Great job
Great app working perfectly with msfs2020 no need to buy trackIR.
Incredible, seemless setup with FS20 and DCS, worth every penny, good job with this one.

It's my first time trying out head-tracking. I highly recommend this app! - overall setup was very fast and easy (appr. 5 min), default sensitivity settings are fine - app works perfectly with the OpenTrack PC software (free), here you can precisely tweak the curves - immersive experience with simulation games (I tried Flight Simulator 2020, American Truck Simulator, Farming Simulator 2019) Many thanks to the developer/s!
Works exactly as advertised. Clear instructions had me set everything up in a matter of minutes. I have been using it for MSF2020 and have not encountered any issues. Thanks for making this app!
Very good App! It's relatively easy to set up and use in 10min. A little bit of drift but not much! For the price it is absolutely superb!
This is freaking awesome. Small lag, easily overcome by simply moving your head a little bit slower. Othwise, it works like a charm.
Incredible. This beats paying way more for a tracking solution that requires strapping a bit of kit to your head. Works perfectly with FS2020!
Works perfect. No need for track ir
Amazing! Changes the whole Sim experience.

Amazing! Easy to set up. Works great for FSX Steam version only one request. Can we get some basic instructions on how to tweak the curves? Is there a way of keeping it level when turning left or right. Always seem to roll view. What am I missing? Thanks for a budget friendly app for replacing hat switch panning.!!!

Works really well and great price. Touching your face makes it confused, would be great if it could ignore such things. Being able to connect via usb to reduce input lag would also be a great improvement!

Hi John, today I bought the app for my Android phone (Galaxy S10) and I am very happy with the new gaming experience so far (MSFS 2020). Best 10 euros I've ever spent! Five stars for you. I'll be interested in any future developments regarding the app but mostly I just want to say how happy I am with the way it works. Best regards to you!
Works perfectly, just make sure you're on a 5g wifi network. Makes track ir and other hardware based solutions obsolete.
Great App!! Very robust tracking but seem to have a large latency issue. If there is a fix to the latency definitely the best app out there for head tracking!

Awesome and simplistic tool for use in Flight sims and tons of other sims and games! The developer keeps updating and that makes it that much better! Now, this not a replacement to high cost head tracking like TrackIR but it does very nicely as an in between. Another thing is depending on your phone and model and type of cameras and ai it uses you can get more quality out of this amazing app. It uses both to simulate head movement into what game or sim you are playing. Used for fs2020 & IL-2
Excellent Tracking app. I'm glad I found it, so won't be spending money on devices. Works flowlessly with Microsoft Flight simulator 2020. Thanks!

Works way more better than I expected! Great job. Launched it on Android, never had any issues with the app while using in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. It only took me some time in the very initial setup with that alligning and sensitivity calibration stuff. But eventualy this has put the immersion level for me to the totally new step and for just "beta price". But honestly, I would have paid even more for this :-)
Doing God's work. Works flawlessly. Worth every penny. Works in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and Elite Dangerous (any supporting TrackIR games I guess?)
Brilliant piece of kit at a fraction of the cost of even a budget TrackIR option. I've tried other phone based face trackers before but this was by far the best.
works great with MSFS. Easy setup
Works amazingly well, blown away by how much it helps for sims
Great App. Thanks for your effort. Please make some preset DCS / P3D profiles for open track available for head tracking noobs like me. Cheers!

This app is a real boon. It almost turns your flight simulator into a virtual reality experience. Installation is a 5 minute process, as long as you follow the author's instructions exactly. I contacted the author with a question, and he came back with the answer that I needed within 12 hours. This app works perfectly with FSX SE and MSFS and would, I am sure, would with many other flight Sims and similar POV games. Very highly recommended.
Works very well, better than I thought it would. Well worth the price to upgrade your msfs experience
Works great. Would be even better if it could run in the background so I can also use Stream Deck Mobile on the same phone.

This app is amazing. I've tried a desktop app from another publisher and it didn't work very well so I was skeptical at first but when I tried it this it blew my mind. It seems to track movement accurately and couple that with the dead zone and sensitivity options in opentrack you can get this to work exactly how you want. It's been a game changer for me!

Great app. I have two computers, a flight sim in the garage and my desktop where I mess around with addons and features before incorporating them in the sim. I've been moving my TrackIR setup back and forth, and this app allows me to leave it connected to the sim and stop messing with it. Excellent product.
It actually works!!! Im happy now.

Funny enough, this my first app purchase from Play store and I'm not regretting! App works great on my Samsung Note 8 but does not install on my old Xiaomi Mi5 (probably too old and not AR compatible). Initially I was a little bit mixed as the tracking for jerky and made me motion sick. Try their profile available on their website and its a whole lot better now! Great addition software for flight Sim 2020!

Incredibly fun with Project Wingman. Works with X4 Foundations, and after replacing a DLL file also works for Everspace. Basically anything that supports TrackIR or Open Track should work. Never really considered Track IR but this little app was too convenient to turn down. Turns out I love it. Will be using it for practically all cockpit games from now on.

Excellent software/math, but a better interface (like the one in the iOS version) and also a usb mode to connected it to the pc, are needed. The last one is quite challenging technically but the first one is needed. However I am staying with this app for the long run so that is why I gave it 5 stars, when in reality it should be 3.5 for the amount paid. The only advice as a fellow developer is to never push a broken update or not one tested fully, so I am here for any beta testing if needed.

Absolutely brilliant. This app just works, and works flawlessly as intended. After just a few minutes in I got completely hooked. The game is so much fluid and engaging without the constant need to reach to the mouse for panning to peek at the scenery or flip some switches or get some instruments reading, just quickly nod my head or track a landmark. It's a must have for any casual or enthusiastic sim player out there. Very well worth every penny.
Excellent app. Awesome facial recognition. It works GREAT. Just has a small delay. Tested with MSFS 2020.

Great app I did have a little difficulty time trying to get it to work which was a problem with setting the inbound Port connection I had it set for TCP it should have been set for UDP. With that being said the software developer responded immediately to my email but I had it already figured out great program great customer service.
I bought this without high expectations, but not only has it exceeded them, I'm now using it instead of TrackIR! I think it does just as good a job (for me) without the head gear.

This is a terrific app. After some difficulty getting it to work in FS9 I emailed the developer who was able to identify the problem (missing .dll in FS modules), provided a link for download - up and running after nearly giving up. Truly excellent email support from the developer.

Works way better than simply using a phone as a webcam and makes msfs way more immersive. The tracking isn't 100% perfect and does drain the battery a fair bit, but is a surprisingly good solution for is simplicity.

I have been using the app for microsoft flight sim and it has been great, makes it much easier to see what is happening then the static camera options you get in game. Setup was not difficult so long as you follow along with the instructions or watch the video the dev made walking through the setup. I have found the tracking quality to be good overall, i have used the .ini file for opentrack avalible on the devs website which exagerates your head movements to make it easier to look around while keeping your eyes on the screen so i would recommend it. Overall definatly worth the 15 AUD i spent on it.
Works as advertised on my s20+ with MSFS 2020. Thank you so much!

SmoothTrack works excellently in DCS. The tracking is very smooth and responsive. For IL-2 and Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 the tracking is very good. The tracking works a lot better in vertical orientation. I play couch gaming and put the phone on a selfie stick with a built in tripod. The dev has a configuration ini file you can use on his website if you are interested in his own MS FS 2020 settings. The developer is very responsive to e-mails if you have any questions.

Brilliant alternative to the more expensive trackIR. Surprisingly accurate. Makes keeping situational awareness much easier, especially when flying the pattern/circuit. I use it in FS2020 and have has no problems so far. If you're looking for affordable headtracking, just buy it!

SmoothTrack is truly remarkable. It works just as advertised, is easy to setup as long as you follow the written instructions and even easier if you watch the YouTube tutorial. It works perfectly with my Microsoft Flight Simulator without any other added options. It also works with my P3D simulator along with my ChasePlane camera add-on with the two Track-IR buttons turned on in ChasePlane. The author of this app also provides exceptional customer service when help is needed.
need help to install to redmi node9 pro, i can install it on note 8, but cannot install on new fon
replyContent: The phone needs to have AR capabilities in order for this app to work. Can you contact me at contact@smoothtrack.app if you have questions? Thanks!

content: SmoothTrack 1.0 is compatible with OpenTrack for Linux and Windows, allowing X-Plane 11.50 to use head tracking with my Google Pixel 3XL Android phone. A very fair price!

I've been using this in Flight Simulator and it's very impressive. Easy to set up and a great flying experience, especially VFR. As well as binding a key to centering, I'd suggest binding a key to "toggle" in OpenTrack to turn on and off head tracking. It's great on take off and landing but when I'm flying along I like to use the mouse to scroll. Amazing piece of kit - this is complicated technology and it's bundled in a really usable way.

Works straight out of the box, no random glitches or freezes in tracking and very low latency. This app lives up to its name and makes a world of difference for anyone who enjoys flight simulation, definitely worth every penny and then some.

Amazing application, would definitely recommend trying this if you don't have Track IR and are considering some kind of solution works very smooth in both MSFS and American Truck Sim. Made my experience in both games that much better. For 10$ This app has amazing value. Thank you so much for everything!

I am a trackIR user and though trackir has great tracking, I was interested in this solution given ease of use. With trackir, I have to attach the ir module to my headset, plus a 5v rechargeable battery. Its weight and wires on my headset that becomes uncomfortable after a while. Plus trackir does not work in daylight. This solution thus far has worked great without the hassle of wires, battery, and sensor all velcro strapped to my headset. Simply place my phone in front of me and go!

Using with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. Fairly easy setup. It uses Open track, found that mapping "center" to button in OpenTrack was helpful to auto align your head position. Also mapping button in OpenTrack to toggle tracking on/off also was key. Small issue where app may stop working, seems like if you go to text or another app, but close and reopen app and works again. Hopefully will come out with option to use webcam for more flexibility.
Works well, trying to get it to be a bit smoother by changing the mapping for ETS 2.
Fantastic application, thank you for sharing your work with the world. Great for adding that extra level of immersion for us casual simmers and those new to the genre üòÅ

This is amazing. I've used it for 3 test landings after a very simple install and its fantastic. Cant wait to try it out in other games too. If my long term experience matches first impression then this is the best $10 I've spent, in a long line of computer equipment. Thanks! I hope you make millions off this app! I eas irritated at first to miss Beta at $5 but now, I'd have probably paid $20! Not suggesting you raise the price, just letting people know its worth every penny.
Fantastic TrackIR alternative! Fantastic tracking and surprisingly accurate considering it uses your phone's camera. Absolutely worth a try if you play any flight Sims or racing Sims!

This is a great little app that works very well! I needed to allow the port through the windows firewall and then it all just worked without any other fiddling about. It definitely benefits from a bit of tweaking the curves in opentrack, but that's par for the course with everyone having different devices and seating arrangements. This app has already received a number of good feature updates in a short amount of time and is nearing perfection in my book... Being able to offload the face processing task away from the main gaming pc is something I've been after for a while, and finally here it is!

Price just doubled... Not happy. I saw 4.49 and then I had to pay 9.99‚Ç¨ Aand then I had to get a refund. Doesn't work on FS2020. Seems to work on the desktop but then inside FS nothing.... Edit: I did pick freetrack 2. In FS the view was sideways then I hit the center hotkey and it centered. But it didn't change, it didn't recognize my pose anyway like before on the windows desktop.
replyContent: It works great on FS2020. If you pick output "FreeTrack 2.0 enhanced" and then subtype "Both" it will work fine. Also, the lower price was during Early Access only, as clearly stated in the app description and web site.

content: Changes FS2020 into a real experience. Having a camera controlled with your head adds so much more functionality on top of a joystick. See the YouTube video comments for any setup issues.
Sweet app! Does the trick for MFS 20. Won't be needing a triple monitor because of this!
Wonderful. Setting up on network is quick and easy and once set up it works flawlessly. It even works for me under low light conditions. Very much worth it and recommended.

One of a kind app, been looking for this kind of app forever. easy to use and install, works on all of my games that can use headtracking like flight sims. Been recommending to other people I rate it 15/10
Works really well in games like Arma 3 even as a more casual player paying for this was a better deal then spending big on a full trackir set. Would love to maybe see rear camera support as well.
Purchased this app for MSFS2020, works exactly as described. Setup was straight forward, highly recommended. Great value compared to other alternatives.
Best thing since sliced bread! Life changing stuff. Easy setup, simple instructions. Thanks dev

I'm a fairly avid Flight Simmer, but never really got the hype around head-tracking. Until I tried it. This program was extremely easy to setup and use (worked very first try with Microsoft Flight Simulator), and did a fantastic job of making it super easy to look around the cockpit, look out the window, duck down and change the settings on my PFD, etc. It was shockingly natural at how easily it all just "worked". I'm amazed, and very appreciative. I will be a dedicated user for a long time now, I'm sure.

Like many others, I found myself in need head tracking although the thought of paying the price for the likes of TrackIR which can retail for well over ¬£100 leaves a bad taste in the mouth not to mention the current situation about being able to get it in stock. When I seen this pop up on reddit community r/flightsim with the preview video I knew instantly that I wanted it and purchased ASAP (This is the first app that I've actually paid for, not really using my phone for anything other than making calls). I now focus more on what's going on ingame rather than how contorted I can get my arms in trying to land a plane and look around for the throttle using mouse amongst other things. Furhtermore the ability and enjoyment it will bring to ETS2 is something that I'm very much looking forward to. Additionally I'm also visually impaired so the ability to use something like this to increase my zoom potential with slight leaning towards the camera compared to my nose touching the screen, it makes for a far better experience. Probably better for my eyes too! I'm very pleased with the application. It works brilliantly and the developer is very engaging and helpful regarding feedback, improvements or issues. Hopefully more and more people share their open track settings so if you're unsure of setting-up the open track side of things to suit your specific needs, that someone may have already created the perfect solution for you. Once again very pleased and urge you to save yourself some money and support a deserving developer instead!
This is great and a steal at the price. Fiddly to set up but once done works like a dream - great job!
It works great üëç
Works like a charm. Great addition to the Microsoft Flight Simulator ‚úàÔ∏è and Euro Truck simulator üöö

This app is simply impressive. I cant explain the joy on my face as I looked around at my surroundings while flying a bush trip on msfs 2020, or the sheer awe as I was able to easily spot other aircraft while flying missions in dcs. Seamless, functional head tracking for only ten bucks? Yes please!

Amazing!, I've been using this app because i don't have a vr headset or 3 screens, and I love it!, Works perfectly with Assetto Corsa, ETS2 and F1 2019!, And for a low price too!, 10/10 100/100 recommended

Thanks very much for this. It works very well with the Note20 Ultra. The setup was straight forward and Smoothtrack has been working flawlessly for me. I have been using it with the Microsoft Flight Simulator and it really takes the experience up a notch.

It functions way better than most solutions and on the first attempt. Went through the setup instructions for the app and PC and got it working in MSFS2020 within 5 minutes. A few very minor issues only. If I use multitasking on my phone and switch back to SmoothTrack, the video feed is just black and I have to restart the app. At very shallow angles, it has difficulty measuring the distance to your face. If you turn your head too much, the position goes back like 10 feet.

Works great right "out-of-the-box." I was able to test SmoothTrack with both X-Plane 11 and Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020, and it's true to its name; the tracking is incredibly smooth. I also own ViewTracker, and even after tinkering with those settings dozens of times, this app works far better and requires almost zero configuration. I whole-heartedly recommend SmoothTrack to anyone interested in flight sims, or other games and simulators that support TrackIR. Very well done.

Fantastic app, does exactly as advertised, and is a breeze to set up. I use it for Elite: Dangerous, and it tracks my head movement flawlessly. The PC client has great customization for tracking as well. It does wonders for immersion, and is 100% worth getting!

This app works perfectly. I've probably tried all other options available for cheap facetracking (didn't buy trackIR) and this is 100x better than anything I've tried. Life changing. I am using it with DCS and MSFS and having zero issues. Low light performance is awesome (only monitor light) on my S10. It is worth every penny and I recommend if you want a good face tracking experience.

Amazing work by the Developer, this app is much more hassle free and is easy and quick to setup, can definetly recommend this app as a cheaper and better (in my opinion) alternative to VR or Trackir and it works very well with DCS and MSFS 20.
First test in FS2020 went very well. I haven't used tracking software like this before, but now that I got used to it I don't want to play without it. Great job!
5 star review because this app saved me from spending ¬£150 on Trackir. This works beautifully on MFS with my P30 Pro and the developer is very active with updates. Well worth buying.
Works exactly as described. Easy to set up and makes a world of difference in Flight Sim 2020
Flawless, works very well. Regularly updated and a highly responsive developer. Couldn't be happier!
This app works flawlessly. Definitely worth it.

replyContent: I am considering adding this - this may improve the tracking actually

content: Awesome app, once set up works really well, many thanks
Absolute magic. Well done to the creator. Just brillant

content: While other apps that work with Opentrack require you to duct tape the phone to your head, this uses your phone's front camera and nothing else! It's not perfect but considering this costs only $10, you can't ignore the value for casual simmers like me. A little advice, if you're like me and can't get the tracking to behave, download the Opentrack profile that's on the developer's website. Can definitely be improved but I'm really happy with it right now. Working in both MS Flight Sim and Elite.
replyContent: Awesome, thank you! Please spread the word about the app to the MSFS and Elite gaming communities.
